comment.text: This is our favorite place for ramen in Atlanta. We love the vibe, staff and all the items we've had. Their drinks are good too! I'd only ask if they diversify their dessert menu, although a ramen place doesn't need to :)

I would be lying if I say that I don't love a good bowl of ramen. This place not only has great ramen but a good atmosphere/aesthetics. I visited on a Friday night and I must say it was definitely crowded to say the least. The hostess was friendly and helpful we were seated within minutes. In my book that's always a good sign. Our server came over and introduced himself. For appetizer, I got the seaweed salad and my main meal was the spicy chicken ramen. Whew, honestly I love the ramen because it's packed with tons of flavor. You can add additional toppings if you like however that can rank up in price. For extra flavor I added some minced garlic and it hit the spot. Lastly, to me the broth wasn't unbearably hot but just a little spicy. I like to add extra spice to mine which brings all the flavors together. Can't wait to come back.

So glad that I found Jinya. The reviews were great so mom and I popped in to grab some late afternoon ramen.
Jinya is located in a small strip mall. Parking was easy. 
Inside I was surprised to see how many people were dining, considering how early it was. There was plenty of seating and the bartender who served us was super nice.
I had the Tonkotsu Black ramen with a little heat added. Mom had the chicken ramen. Mine was superb. Very flavorful - lots of yummy stuff in it. The seasoned egg was delicious. I also loved the fried onion and garlic chips added for flavor. The portions were plenty for a meal and prices were fair for what you get. 
I will definitely be back again one of these days. Definitely worth checking out

Chicken wonton ramen for me with some crispy salmon poke tacos. Party for two and we were in and out within 20 minutes. Hits the spot on a chilly winter evening. 

We always recommend this spot for guests visiting from out of town. There's something on the menu for everyone! #NoRamenNoLife

When we walked in the host was on a personal phone call and there were people obviously waiting for the hosts attention and we waited in front of the host for about 5 minutes. 
The dining area is beautifully designed but the kitchen and music were loud and it was hard to have a conversation. 
The curry over rice was relatively plain looking but surprisingly packed a lot of flavor. The ramen dishes were generally good. The broth was complex and the proportions of noodles to toppings to broth was perfect, that said the spicy bowls were not at all spicy (the server never asked our preferred spice level).

I absolutely love this place! The food was amazing, great drinks and the service can't be beat! We started off with lycheetinis tempora shrimp and salmon poke tacos. All were flavorful and delicious. We both got the tonkatsu black ramen which was really good but when we added the seasoning flavor offered on the table it was phenomenal! Jonathan was our waiter and he was very attentive! He greeted us as soon as we were seated and promptly took our drink orders. If you haven't been you need to check it out. Great food and reasonable prices!

Food here was delicious. It was speedy and fresh. The pork chashu buns were fatty and crispy on the outside and so savory, and the little veggies in the fluffy bun cut through and balanced that richness. The pork yuzu shio was rich but balanced with the yuzu flavor and citrus that really shown through the broth. The shrimp wontons were so juicy and paired so well with the richness and creaminess of the broth. Our waiter Ian was very sweet and attentive, I hope to have him again if I stop by! It's a pretty big place with outdoor seating as well, with ambient lighting and a chic feel.

So Jinya usually does not disappoint. It's in a shopping center, so be aware of that when you look for parking ... Depending on the time of day. 

The space is nice. They have a bar area, indoor seating, tables at a ramen bar area, and patio seating as well (it's pretty in closed though). They have some TVs there at the bar if you wanted to check out a game. It's not set up like a sports bar so don't expect them wall to wall 

I sat at the bar. The bar was not particularly busy but it looked like the bartender was doubling as a server and busser so he took a while to get to me. Not his fault though, I totally get that. 

I had the octopus balls and the tonkotsu black (with brussel sprouts).

Had a great dinner here at JINYA Ramen Bar. I had the ramen with dumplings. I added garlic onion, and chicken. My daughter had the pork ramen. She also added garlic and extra pork! Her dad had the spicy Ramen bowl. He added garlic and chicken! As you can see from our pictures we enjoyed our dinner. Everything was delish!!! We will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: My daughter had the pork ramen.

comment.text: Convenient location near 285 and a good place to meet a friend for lunch. Quick and efficient around noon on a Friday. It was my first time having ramen so I went super basic with the Jinya chicken ramen. Lots of meat, nice flavor. My friend is GF and found easy options. A good basic place for occasional rotation.

Coming into the establishment the decor was very nice and clean and sharp. You treat it with a warm welcome, I don't know the language, but I thought it was pretty cool that they did it every time so came in. My weight staff was extremely pleasant and even asked, my niece, a couple of questions about her meal to make sure everything was great. The food came out very quickly and we completely enjoyed the taste of flavors. I'm grateful that they were accommodating and allowing me to add shrimp to my meal and remove the meat.

I was forced to order the crispy rice appetizer which after I asked if I could buy only crispy rice to which they said no... how hard is that to do? Then while waiting on my order at the bar the bartender went on so long to a different guest wit checking on me talking about a fishing trip that my food was ready and I left before I could get a water.

photos.caption: $10 for only 3 pieces and they didn't put the tar tar on top. Uhm excuse me...

comment.text:
Delicious in every bite. I came with three people and we all ordered the same thing and had a different take on it. 

I loved my bowl- the egg was perfect, the greens added the perfect amount of salt and overall the broth was garlicky and soothing to my soul. The meat was flavorful and tender and the place was overall clean with trendy decor. 

My two friends I came with felt that the seaweed added to much of an ocean flavor to the bowl aand the garlic made the bowl a bit spicy for one and the other felt that it wasn't spicy enough- thankfully they have spices you can add to your personal preference. 

The noodle thickness was perfect and overall would eat her everyday if I could.

As someone who has been to Japan and tasted ramen over there, I fully admit, I can be a bit snobby or hard to please about ramen back here in the US. (I sound so pretentious right now don't worry I know haha). Saying this, this was the tastiest ramen I have eaten in awhile. My family eats here often and they decided to take me for the first time and I loved it. They offer delicious vegetarian options that I was excited to try.

I ordered the Spicy Creamy Vegan Ramen and added a Marinated Egg ($15.80). My step-mother is also vegetarian and got the Flying Vegan Harvest Ramen and added a Marinated Egg as well ($16.80). She also ordered the Impossible Gyoza ($9.50) for the table. My ramen was so creamy and I felt like it had a great depth of flavor. I tried my step-mother's order as well and it was also was good. It had more of an earthy flavor. However, I still think that my ramen was superior. If you love creamy ramen you have to try it. I was also pleasantly surprised by the Impossible Gyoza. I did not know what to expect, however it was crispy and the filling was seasoned very well with lots of ginger. No one was missing the meat at all. I would definitely order this again as well.

The ambience inside was very comforting. I love when places have windows to the kitchen so that you can see the food being made. We came in close to closing time and the staff were very accommodating and patient as well.

photos.caption: Top: "Flying Vegan Harvest Ramen" Bottom: "Spicy Creamy Vegan Ramen"

comment.text:
After some more visits to Jinya, this place has proved that they know ramen. We came on a Saturday lunch and I had their Flying Vegan bowl. 

Served with tons of topping and spiced perfectly, this is the best ramen in town. Run and get your bowl of perfect ramen. We will keep returning.
Jillian was very friendly! The wings were good and my daughter enjoyed the kids meal. Reasonably priced!
Service was great, cool atmosphere, incredible food. The food came out super quick. I got the dish thats black something. It's below the chicken section on the menu

First time here! I definitely loved the warm "welcome" of the staff. Coming in the place is pretty intimate with different types of seating. A fully stocked bar and plenty on the menu to choose from. I tried the Spicy Chicken Ramen and added a few extra things to my bowl also. Also tried the pork Gyoza and enjoyed it! For lunch time, I thought it would be SUPER busy but it wasn't which made for a quick in and out!

I got the JINYA black but ordered it spicy, with extra shiitake mushrooms and bamboo shoots, and it was all really good. The bamboo was a bit tough, but the thick noodles I substituted were sooooo good. Would definitely recommend.

I've come here many times and have never been disappointed. I usually get the spicy creamy vegan ramen and that's my go-to. 

This time I got the pork chashu bowl and that was also very fresh and tasty. I always love the soft boiled egg that's added. The service here is great, but they can get busy. Make sure to join the waitlist before going.

I've found my favorite ramen place! The ambiance is nice. The have an inside and outside area. Both nice! The service is great. Jennifer was very helpful and friendly! But the ramen.... OMG! I had the black something and it was DELICIOUS!!!
Food was delicious! Service was great from the host to the server and the ambiance was fun! We had a great time. Would recommend!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at JINYA Ramen Bar and I must say, it was an outstanding experience. The waitress went above and beyond to accommodate my request for spice in my JINYA Tonkotsu Black ramen, ensuring I was satisfied throughout my meal. The flavors of the ramen were truly delicious, and I couldn't resist finishing every last bite. The attentive service and the delightful combination of flavors make JINYA Ramen Bar a highly recommended dining spot. Don't miss out on this fantastic ramen experience!
My favorite Ramen Bar ever!! I drive an hour and a half to go here. It's worth every bit!

Usually go to the one in Sandy Springs (Roswell Rd) but I stopped by at the Buckhead location yesterday (Monday) right before 6 PM & we didn't have to wait to be seated. 

The space is great, nice ambiance. 

I ordered my usual flying vegan harvest & it was delicious as always! A little spicier than normal but still so good. The edamame was good as well & the vegan gyoza were pretty good. Food was wonderful like usual. 

My one complaint is that our server seemed to have forgotten that he had a table(s?) & after the food was brought out, he did not check on us even once. I had to flag down a different server to bring our check out since ours was busy taking to go orders. We'd been waiting for quite some time for him to come bring it & you could tell we'd been done eating for quite some time too (well over 15 minutes). 

I prefer the service in Sandy Springs but no complaints on the food!

I have to yet to find a ramen place that I love as much as Jinya, especially the Buckhead location. The food here is fabulous as is the service. Be aware that they don't take reservations, so expect a little bit of a wait. 

I love the shrimp tempura as an appetizer. The shrimp is perfectly crispy and the spicy mayo on the top is so flavorful. My favorite ramen on the menu is the Tonkotsu spicy. I usually get it spicy and add some corn and garlic and hot for some more flavor, but I love the texture and flavor of the pork and the broth. I think I could eat that soup every day of my life. My mom is a vegetarian and she LOVES the spicy creamy vegan extra spicy. 

Definitely, definitely recommend Jinya!

I really don't have any complaints. The gyoza were really delicious and juicy. The crispy chicken was seasoned very well and had fresh flavor. The yuzo shio delight was also really great. I feel like the broth didn't splash as much since the noodles were smaller. The waiter was very attentive and gave us space to enjoy our meal. Great experience overall!

This place is amazing! From the food and service to the ambiance, I was delighted to dine here. 

I got the Tonkotsu spicy with a seasoned egg and seaweed. Every bite was a burst of flavor and I couldn't help but close my eyes and savor each moment. (I know this sounds dramatic, but I'm 100% serious. I don't play around when it comes to food.)

My mom ordered a vegan option on the menu and, as someone who loves meat, she absolutely loved the vegan dish.

The menu is well suited for a variety of dietary needs and they allow substitutions for almost all their dishes. 

The service was also a 10/10. As you are taken to your table, the entire staff welcomes you with a Japanese greeting. 

I definitely recommend, and I will definitely be returning to this establishment!
Good food, really like it. The bar looks good too, will try it some other day. The bun is very unique, ramen is tasty, a bit on the salty side.

Now being a chain - you can tell JINYA has decided to keep quality up from their experience of other franchises, in practically everything. From the aesthetic, service, and food. It's all going to meet a level of quality that you're going to be pretty satisfied with I bet. This level of quality is also going to demand a higher cost in combination with the idea that ramen is getting consider fancier (and maybe I'm just not used to this inflation thing). That being said, I don't think it's going to completely blow you away, but I also think it's hard to find really good ramen in Atlanta that will tower over this restaurant either.
The food was really good and the service was too. I'll be back for more soon :).

We came here on a Thursday evening right before they were super busy and it was a good experience overall. I wasn't sure if ramen would be too messy, lots of splashing, slurping and noodles flying everywhere. Boy, was I wrong, the noodles and broth were so tasty. I was in between a pork and saw the special offer on the table which included a side of crispy chicken. It worked out really well. They charge a dollar extra if you ask for hot flavoring which was kind of annoying, but glad I got the extra spice. Only wish they had more craft brew on draft! I had a Basement POG which appeared to be the most locally craft for ATL. The pairing worked out. Definitely would recommend coming back during non peak hours to enjoy the restaurant dining experience.

Wow. Five years ago, I had ramen for the first time here. And I've been coming back since. My go to is the vegetable ramen with the creamy vegan broth as a substitute. Sadly they no longer have the creamy vegan in the menu but there is something a bit similar! I enjoyed the beyond meat dumplings here, really flavorful. The bartenders make the drinks well. No complaints, I always have a good experience at jinya in buckhead!
Door dash delivery. No utensils provided. Food was good. Could be better especially considering the price.

Hands down one of my favorite Ramen spots in Atl... From the service to the food.. The staff is very nice also. The place is clean and I like the fact they yell welcome in Japanese when you are being seated.
The food was 10/10, and very reasonably priced. I ordered the a the special, which is a disassembled ramen, and the broth was so rich! I highly recommend, and plan on visiting again. :)

First time visiting this restaurant but it won't be my last. Everything came out fast and was very good and flavorful.  I had the spicy chicken Ramen and my Daughter had the Karaage Chicken Ramen. Both were delicious.  We also tried the Brussel Sprots and the Pork Gyozas... they were awesome as well.

Make reservations. It's not imperative but definitely a good idea for a weekend. We didn't make reservations and we only had to wait about 10 minutes, but I suspect if we had arrived earlier the wait would have been longer. The menu is what you would expect of a ramen bar. I really like the apps. The crispy chicken is actually tenders and delicious AF. I also really enjoyed the buns. We got the chef's special shrimp, but they also have impossible meat and pork. I definitely want to try the other apps next time. Not enough room in my belly for more than one app AND Ramen unfortunately. We sat at the bar, which was fine although I think I would've preferred a high top. I hate sitting next to who I'm talking to lol. I really like that they have meatless options on their menu, whether you're not eating meat for religious reasons or your diet doesn't include meat, it's definitely a great option to have. The food was delicious and very well made. Service was also excellent. Our server was Nicolas and he was very attentive and informative. We will definitely be back.

We came by because of the reviews. It's not bad. I think you'll be satisfied. After imagine Korean fast food. Now I got the steak Bulgogi. And it's not like the bug over. You're going to get on Buford Highway. But it is very eatable. I think if you're nearby and you need a place to eat give it a try. If you're driving 30 minutes to come, I would say hold off.
Nick was awesome as our server. He did a great job over all and the food was phenomenal as well. We will definitely be back

This was my first Ramen experience. My friends took me here to try it for the first time. I don't eat red meat or chicken, so my options were limited. I tried the vegan bowl and it was very flavorful. My noodles were thicker than the others, but I didn't mind it because it made me full real fast. I also had the tempura Brussel sprouts and they were good once I dropped them into some sort of soy sauce. We had a kid with us so they were very accommodating. I was low-key jealous of how much the kids meal provided. Overall, great experience and great food!

Love, love, loooooove me some JINYA Ramen !! This just further proves that every single location is consistent and absolutely wonderful. The flavor doesn't change and I'm always left satisfied. I got the JINYA Tonkotsu Black of course, which has pork broth, pork chashu, kikurage, green onion, nori dried seaweed, seasoned egg, garlic chips, garlic oil, fried onion and a dab of spicy sauce. They're served with served with thin noodles but you can ask for thick if that's your preference. They also have a nice full bar if you want to sit alone or with a friend and get some drinks !

Always enjoy my food when I come! Definitely have great options to add to your bowl and the flavors are always great. Service is pretty good and it's a pretty good ambiance. Very chill and welcoming !
The food was really good! Vegan options great! I got a the seaweed salad, a hot sake, and the spicy creamy, vegan Ramen! I will be back soon to try other option!

photos.caption: Vegetable spicy cream Spicy Creamy Vegan Ramen

comment.text: Excellent ramen with a rich, long-simmered broth. Many options for customizing your meal.
They don't have a ton of options for people that only eat chicken I realized that they are heavy focused on pork and beef.
Ramen here is spot on. Add the egg and it's pure perfection. Relaxed and low key type of ambiance. Service is always consistently great.
Very slow service. Like.....very slow. Ramen is good buttttt it didn't taste authentic. Nice ambience. Great bar.

Kids meal is great I love it n so does my son. The adult ramen is amazing I order take out a lot that's why it's 4 stars as they ALWAYS forget something in the takeout order no ice cream or seaweed or something paid for spicy bean sprouts got none!!!

Wow...Finished our takeout order 20 minutes ago and still trying to figure out this place has such a high rating?
Spent over $100 for 2 ppl just to try multiple dishes and not one impressed me. All the dishes had Little taste. They forgot our Brussels sprouts and the spice on one order. Jalapeño corn blah..Broccolini was ok taste but undercooked. Ramen chicken wonton was the best out of all but had to add add salt , garlic salt n pepper to give it a good taste..I could go on about rest of order specifically but in the end it just wasn't that good. Wouldn't order again that's for sure.
